org.apache.river.test.spec.lookupservice

Class QATestUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.river.test.spec.lookupservice.QATestUtils

  • public class QATestUtils
extends Object
    Provides useful constants and utility methods and classes for all classes of the Lookup component of the Jini System. Each field and member class, and most methods, contained in this class is public and static; this class does not need to be instantiated.
    See Also:
    QATestEnvironment, QATestRegistrar

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  QATestUtils.SrvcAttrTuple
      Class which models an event "tuple" (service,attribute,transition).

      From the assumption that an event was registered using a template containing the class of both the input srvcObj argument and the attrObj argument, this method "predicts" all of the service/attribute "pairs" corresponding to the set of events that will be generated from the "base" pair represented by the input srvcObj/attrObj pair.
      static void setExpectedEvents(Object srvcObj, net.jini.core.lookup.ServiceItem[] srvcItems, net.jini.core.lookup.ServiceItem[] srvcsForEquals, net.jini.core.entry.Entry[][] attrs, int nSrvcsPerClass, net.jini.core.lookup.ServiceTemplate[][] template, QATestUtils.SrvcAttrTuple[][][] preEventState, QATestUtils.SrvcAttrTuple[][][] postEventState, List tuples)
      From the assumption that the addition, modification or deletion of an attribute of one of the registered service classes will result in one or more events being generated by the lookup service, this method "predicts" all of the service/attribute "pairs" corresponding to the set of events that will be generated from the "base" pair represented by the input srvcObj/attrObj pair.

      • computeDurAndWait

        public static void computeDurAndWait(long baseT0,
                                     long deltaT,
                                     Object lock)
                              throws Exception
        Computes a wait duration based on the given "start" time, a desired increment (assuming instanteous time -- the given deltaT), and an adjustment to correct for compute time (the current time). A negative duration will be treated as an invalid -- or "unresolved" -- test case. If the duration is non-negative, then this method will sleep for that many milliseconds, and then return.
        Parameters:
        baseT0 - the start time
        deltaT - time increment
        Throws:
        TestException - usually indicates a failure
        Exception

      • verifyEventVector

        public static void verifyEventVector(Collection<net.jini.core.lookup.ServiceEvent> events,
                                     int nExpectedEvnts,
                                     int expectedTransition,
                                     net.jini.core.lookup.ServiceRegistration[] serviceRegs)
                              throws Exception
        Determines if all of the expected (and no un-expected) events have arrived. The test in this method depends on the semantics of event-notification. That is, it will use the fact that if the events were generated for each service class in sequence (which they were), although the events may arrive out of order, they can be arranged back into the same sequence using RemoteEventComparator. This means we can expect, when examining the event corresponding to index i, that the serviceID returned in the ServiceEvent should correspond to the i_th service registered. If it does not, remote events are missing and failure is declared. This method is currently employed by the following test classes: NotifyOnAttrAdd NotifyOnAttrMod NotifyOnAttrDel NotifyOnSrvcLeaseExpiration
        Parameters:
        events - vector containing the events to test
        nExpectedEvnts - number of events expected
        expectedTransition - the expected event transition
        serviceRegs - array of ServiceRegistrations of each service
        Throws:
        TestException - usually indicates a failure
        Exception

      • dumpEventIDs

        public static void dumpEventIDs(Collection<net.jini.core.lookup.ServiceEvent> events,
                                net.jini.core.lookup.ServiceRegistration[] serviceRegs)

      • verifyEventItems

        public static void verifyEventItems(Collection<net.jini.core.lookup.ServiceEvent> eventsCollection)
                             throws Exception
        Verifies that the ServiceItem in each event is as expected. If there is no later event with the same service ID, then compare the item in the event with the current item in the lookup service. If the item in the event is null, then the item must no longer exist in the lookup service, otherwise the item must exist in the lookup service and be equal to the one in the event. We skip an event if there is a later event with the same service ID, as that means the state of the item recorded in the event was subsequently changed again.
        Parameters:
        events - List containing the events to test
        Throws:
        TestException - usually indicates a failure
        Exception

      • classTypesEqualTypeDescriptors

        public static boolean classTypesEqualTypeDescriptors(Class[] classTypes,
                                                     String[] typeDescriptors)
        Disregarding order, verify that the given set of class types is equal to the given set of type descriptors. For the case where the classType is assignable to net.jini.lookup.entry.ServiceType, it is only required that the class associated with the typeDescriptor also is assignable to net.jini.lookup.entry. This is to handle the case where the actual class is org.apache.river.lookup.entry.BasicServiceType, which may be preferred. This would case an 'equals' comparison to fail. In addition, a special case involves a check for the reggie proxy class. Since the proxy used is configuration dependent, if a typeDescriptor has the value "org.apache.river.reggie.RegistrarProxy", then equality will be satisfied if a classType can be found whose getName method returns either "org.apache.river.reggie.RegistrarProxy" or "org.apache.river.reggie.ConstrainableRegistrarProxy" This method is currently employed by the following test classes: GetServiceTypesEmpty GetServiceTypesClass GetServiceTypesAttr
        Parameters:
        classTypes - array of class types
        typeDescriptors - array of class name descriptors
        Throws:
        TestException - usually indicates a failure

      • getSrvcSupersVector

        public static Vector getSrvcSupersVector(Object obj,
                                         net.jini.core.lookup.ServiceItem[] srvcItems)
                                  throws Exception
        Retrieves the chain of super classes of the given object; up to, but not including, the Object class itself. Returns a vector containing initialized instances of each class in the chain (including the instance of the given object itself). Note: this method is specific to the set of test service classes that are registered during any typical lookup test. Thus, this method should be invoked only on objects that belong to a chain of classes contained in the set of test services; that is, the input object, as well as each of the super classes in the chain have a constructor that requires a single argument of type int.
        Parameters:
        obj - object that is analyzed for its super classes
        srvcItems - array of registered services
        Returns:
        java.util.Vector
        Throws:
        TestException - usually indicates a failure
        Exception
        See Also:
        ServiceItem

      • getNoArgSupersVector

        public static Vector getNoArgSupersVector(Object obj)
                                   throws Exception
        Retrieves the chain of super classes of the input object; up to, but not including, the Object class itself. Returns a vector containing non-initialized instances of each class in the chain (including the instance of the input object itself). Note: this method should be invoked only on objects that have super classes containing no-arg constructors.
        Parameters:
        obj - object that is analyzed for its super classes
        Returns:
        java.util.Vector
        Throws:
        TestException - usually indicates a failure
        Exception

      • setExpectedEvents

        public static void setExpectedEvents(Object srvcObj,
                                     net.jini.core.lookup.ServiceItem[] srvcItems,
                                     net.jini.core.lookup.ServiceItem[] srvcsForEquals,
                                     net.jini.core.entry.Entry[][] attrs,
                                     int nSrvcsPerClass,
                                     net.jini.core.lookup.ServiceTemplate[][] template,
                                     QATestUtils.SrvcAttrTuple[][][] preEventState,
                                     QATestUtils.SrvcAttrTuple[][][] postEventState,
                                     List tuples)
                              throws Exception
        From the assumption that the addition, modification or deletion of an attribute of one of the registered service classes will result in one or more events being generated by the lookup service, this method "predicts" all of the service/attribute "pairs" corresponding to the set of events that will be generated from the "base" pair represented by the input srvcObj/attrObj pair. The number and "cause" of these events is dependent on the contents of the template or templates used to register the event notification requests with lookup. This method assumes that an event was registered using a template containing the class of both the input srvcObj argument and the attrObj argument. That is, given the template/event-registration-request assumption just described, if attrObj is added to, modified on, or deleted from srvcObj, then an event will be generated for each service/attribute pair in the lookup service which also matches one of the templates. This method will populate the given tuples vector with the set of service/attribute/transition "tuples" corresponding to the events expected to be generated when the srvcObj's state is modified The tuples vector will contain all of the tuples that have accumulated over the life of the current test run. Thus, because that vector contains all of the expected pairs generated by previous calls to this method, the tuples vector must be created and maintained -- outside of this method -- by the invoking class. This method is currently employed by the following test classes: NotifyOnComboAttrAddNull NotifyOnComboAttrAddNonNull NotifyOnComboAttrModNull NotifyOnComboAttrModNonNull NotifyOnComboAttrDelNull NotifyOnComboAttrDelNonNull NotifyOnComboSrvcReg NotifyOnComboSrvcLeaseExp
        Parameters:
        srvcObj - object whose state has changed
        srvcItems - array of registered services
        srvcsForEquals - array of instantiated services for comparison
        attrs - array-of-arrays of attribute objects for matching
        nSrvcsPerClass - number of service instances per class type
        template - template to use for matching
        preEventState - the state array of tuples prior to the event
        postEventState - the state array of tuples after the event
        tuples - vector in which the expected tuples are accumulated
        Throws:
        TestException - usually indicates a failure
        Exception
        See Also:
        ServiceItem, Entry

      • setExpectedEvents

        public static void setExpectedEvents(int srvcIndx,
                                     net.jini.core.lookup.ServiceItem[] srvcItems,
                                     net.jini.core.lookup.ServiceItem[] srvcsForEquals,
                                     net.jini.core.entry.Entry[][] attrs,
                                     net.jini.core.lookup.ServiceTemplate[] template,
                                     QATestUtils.SrvcAttrTuple[][][] state,
                                     List tuples)
                              throws Exception
        From the assumption that an event was registered using a template containing the class of both the input srvcObj argument and the attrObj argument, this method "predicts" all of the service/attribute "pairs" corresponding to the set of events that will be generated from the "base" pair represented by the input srvcObj/attrObj pair. This method will populate the given tuples vector with the set of service/attribute/transition "tuples" corresponding to the events expected to be generated when the srvcObj's state is modified The tuples vector will contain all of the tuples that have accumulated over the life of the current test run. Thus, because that vector contains all of the expected pairs generated by previous calls to this method, the tuples vector must be created and maintained -- outside of this method -- by the invoking class. This method is currently employed by the following test classes: NotifyOnEntryAttrSrvcReg NotifyOnEntryAttrAddNull NotifyOnEntryAttrAddNonNull
        Parameters:
        srvcIndx - index into the template corresponding to the service
        srvcItems - array of registered services
        srvcsForEquals - array of instantiated services for comparison
        attrs - array-of-arrays of attribute objects for matching
        template - template to use for matching
        state - the state array of tuples after the event
        tuples - vector in which the expected tuples are accumulated
        Throws:
        TestException - usually indicates a failure
        Exception
        See Also:
        ServiceItem, Entry

      • verifyEventTuples

        public static void verifyEventTuples(List receivedTuples,
                                     List expectedTuples,
                                     long maxWaitTime,
                                     boolean showTime,
                                     Object lock)
                              throws Exception
        Compares the number and content of the given set of expected events to the given set of received events; where the event information is stored in the given vectors as objects of class type SrvcAttrTuple
        Parameters:
        receivedTuples - array of received event tuples
        expectedTuples - array of expected event tuples
        maxWaitTime - maximum number of milliseconds to wait for events
        showTime - true/false: write elapsed time to standard output
        Throws:
        TestException - usually indicates a failure
        Exception

      • getMaxNMsToWaitForEvents

        public static long getMaxNMsToWaitForEvents(int nSrvcs,
                                            int nAttrs)
        Based on the number of service class instances and the number of attributes per service participating in the current test run, this method computes and returns the maximum number of milliseconds to wait for all events to arrive from the lookup service before attempting to verify the events.
        Parameters:
        nSrvcs - total number of service instances registered
        nAttrs - total number of attribute instances
        Returns:
        long

      • displayTuples

        public static void displayTuples(Vector tuples)

        tuples - vector in which the expected tuples are accumulated

      • groupsAreEqual

        public static boolean groupsAreEqual(String[] returnedGroups,
                                     ArrayList expectedGroups)
        Removes any repeated elements from the ArrayList and then compares the String elements in the array to the String elements in ArrayList. Returns true if the sets are equal in size and if each element in one set is equal to one element in the other set; returns false otherwise. This method is currently employed by the following test classes: SimpleAddMemberGroups SimpleSetMemberGroups SimpleRemoveMemberGroups
        Parameters:
        returnedGroups - array of String elements from getMemberGroups
        expectedGroups - ArrayList of expected String elements

      • removeRepeatedElems

        public static ArrayList removeRepeatedElems(ArrayList list)
        Removes any repeated elements from the input ArrayList; returns a new ArrayList containing all unique elements from the input list. This method is currently employed by the following test classes: SimpleAddMemberGroups SimpleSetMemberGroups SimpleRemoveMemberGroups
        Parameters:
        list - ArrayList of String elements

      • removeListFromArray

        public static ArrayList removeListFromArray(ArrayList list,
                                            String[] strArray)
        Removes all elements of the String array from the ArrayList; returns a new ArrayList containing the elements of the original ArrayList minus elements from the String array. This method is currently employed by the following test classes: SimpleRemoveMemberGroups
        Parameters:
        list - ArrayList of String elements
        strArray - array of String elements

        Parameters:

      • displayStringArrayList

        Prints the elements of the input ArrayList. Each element of the ArrayList must be of type String. This method is intended to be used only for debugging.
        Parameters:
        list - ArrayList of String elements

      • objsAreEqual

        public static boolean objsAreEqual(Object obj0,
                                   Object obj1)
        Determines if the input Objects are equal; where equality is defined by Class equality and field equality. A special case is subclasses of net.jini.lookup.entry.ServiceType. If both objects are assignable to ServiceType, then class equality is not required. This is necessary to handle the case where org.apache.river.lookup.entry.BasicServiceType is being compared, and one of the object was obtained from a preferred class loader.
        Parameters:
        obj0 - the to compare to obj1 for equality
        obj1 - the to compare to obj0 for equality
        Returns:
        boolean
